text: I added my form's script in my wordpress site, but i need to modify the styling (border/border-radius/font etc) .. are there docs for this because all the elements im targetting in css arent working :')
Do you enable raw html toggle inside you HubSpot form?
I did, but then that means i have to restyle everyythingg. The check box and "this field is required" text are list elements and all wonky
Was curious if there was an easier way first
If you active the checkbox, than you get html, if you uncheck the box then the form will be served inside an iFrame
You can inject your custom styles on mount

Hi everyone! I hope you're all having a great start to the year. I'm reaching out for a bit of help with a HubSpot template issue.
I've been working on customizing a quote template in HubSpot and have run into a warning regarding the absence of the "List of Future Payments" feature. Despite having the following segment in my template, this warning persists when creating a new quote:

```<div class="payment-schedule">
      {% module "payment-schedule" path="<@UDA553DRD>/quote_payment_schedule" %}
    </div>```
To diagnose the issue, I tried adding a payment schedule, which seems to function correctly.

This custom template was created by cloning an existing HubSpot quote template, with some modifications to the line_items_table.module, including a few additional lines of code and renaming it.

Attached is a screenshot and the custom module used in the quote template. Any insights, ideas, or guidance from the community would be incredibly appreciated. Thank you in advance for your help! :blush:

:sparkles:Slack Tips and Best Practices:sparkles:

To get the most out the HubSpot Developer Slack, follow these best practices:

• Will your post/question potentially help more than one person? Ask in a public channel instead of 1:1 DMs to help as many folks as possible. 
• Thread all replies to keep topics organized and searchable
• Thread followup questions/comments to your original post
• Don't post the same question in multiple channels. If you must, link to your original question in new channels.
More <https://slack.com/blog/collaboration/etiquette-tips-in-slack|great tips here>. Thanks for making the HubSpot Developer Slack easier to use for everyone!
I’m dealing with the same issue <@U06CR6P5EMA> - its a real head-scratcher. I even replaced the custom module in the template with the default and still get the same error.
